phases.name: WCF to ASP.NET Core Web API
phases.description: Convert ProductServiceLibrary WCF service to ASP.NET Core 10 Web API
tasks: Create new ASP.NET Core 10 Web API project
Migrate IProductService contract to REST API controllers
Convert data models (Product, Category) to DTOs
Add health checks for Container Apps

phases.name: ASP.NET MVC to ASP.NET Core MVC
phases.description: Convert ProductCatalog web app to ASP.NET Core 10 MVC
tasks: Create new ASP.NET Core 10 MVC project
Update Razor views for ASP.NET Core syntax

phases.name: MSMQ to Azure Service Bus
phases.description: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus for cloud-native messaging
tasks: Set up Azure Service Bus namespace and queue
Replace OrderQueueService with Azure Service Bus client
Update web app to send messages to Service Bus

phases.name: OrderProcessor to Worker Service
phases.description: Convert OrderProcessor console app to .NET 10 Worker Service
tasks: Add health checks and readiness probes

phases.name: Azure Container Apps Deployment
phases.description: Deploy all components to Azure Container Apps
tasks: Deploy Web API as container app
Deploy Web MVC as container app
Deploy Worker Service as container app

risks.description: WCF uses specific serialization that may not be compatible with modern REST APIs
risks.mitigation: Use JSON serialization and carefully test data transfer

risks.description: MSMQ is Windows-specific and not available in containers
risks.mitigation: Replace with Azure Service Bus before containerization

risks.description: Some Razor syntax and HTML helpers may differ between ASP.NET MVC 5 and Core
ASP.NET session state works differently in Core
risks.mitigation: Use distributed cache (Redis) for session in container environment

risks.description: Heavy coupling to System.Web APIs not available in .NET Core
risks.mitigation: Replace with ASP.NET Core abstractions (HttpContext, etc.)

recommendations.rationale: Three distinct components (Web API, Web App, Worker) are ideal for independent container deployment
Cloud-native replacement for MSMQ with better reliability, monitoring, and scaling

recommendations.recommendation: Use REST with JSON over WCF
recommendations.rationale: Better performance, simpler debugging, broader client support

recommendations.recommendation: Use Azure App Configuration or Key Vault
recommendations.rationale: Centralized configuration for multiple container apps with secrets management
Comprehensive monitoring, logging, and diagnostics for containerized apps

recommendations.recommendation: Consider Azure SQL Database or Cosmos DB
recommendations.rationale: Current in-memory repository should be replaced with persistent storage

blockers: WCF service must be converted to REST API
MSMQ must be replaced before containerization
enablers: Clean separation of concerns (MVC, Service, Processor)
Simple data models with no complex inheritance

assumptions: Familiarity with ASP.NET Core and Azure
Access to Azure subscription and resources

notes: No unit tests found - consider adding during migration
In-memory data repository should be replaced with persistent storage
Consider adding authentication/authorization before production deployment
Bootstrap 5 and jQuery 3.7 are relatively modern and can be kept
OrderProcessor is currently not in solution file but exists as standalone console app
